subject: [Announce] JUnit-addons 1.3 released
msgSnippet: *** please do not reply to this email *** ======================== JUNIT-ADDONS 1.3 ======================== I m happy to announce the 1.3 release of
messageBody:
*** please do not reply to this email ***

========================
JUNIT-ADDONS 1.3
========================

I'm happy to announce the 1.3 release of JUnit-addons.
<http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=60272>

This version contains several new classes and fixes coming from user
feedback. See the change log :
<http://sourceforge.net/project/shownotes.php?release_id=148204>

The new assertion method assertEquals(String, String) is similar to the
standard JUnit method but provides more information in certain cases
(e.g. "expected <......> but was <...a...>"). To take advantage of this
new method, simply invoke junitx.framework.Assert.assertEquals(expected,
actual) in your test method.

You can find further information at <http://junit-addons.sf.net>

Thank you for using JUnit-addons

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir R. Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
